result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor G Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: COUNT 2; straight time. If revoked, defendant may attend the Day Reporting Center and participate in vocational training.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $40.00 to be paid to Anthony L. Defendant is not be discharged from probation until the restitution is paid. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
No contact with the victim unless approved by the victim.

Write a letter of apology to Anthony L. by 9/08/2015 and turnover the letter to the juvenile probation agent to send to the victim.
Participate in a cognitive intervention program.
Vocational programming if not enrolled in school full time.

AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment or counseling.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Complete 50 hours of community service as approved by the agent.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: COUNT 1 AMENDED; straight time. If revoked, defendant may attend the Day Reporting Center and participate in vocational training.

records.addlTxt:
Plea hearing proceeded. State placed negotiations on the record. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 AMENDED and COUNT 2-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.

Defendant Victor G Robinson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Victor G Robinson in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500) - PTAC, As A Party to a Crime, contrary to sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05 Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.

COUNT 2- Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500) - PTAC, As A Party to a Crime, contrary to sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05 Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information and waived formal reading.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Victor G Robinson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance; requested a plea and sentencing date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55-A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Victor G Robinson not in court, in custody. 
Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  The state seeking victim's input; joint request for adjourned scheduling date granted.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Victor G Robinson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Victor G Robinson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Release Conditions Order, signed and filed.
TOT to Justice Point: no firearms or weapons; no drugs or alcohol; random testing.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Victor G Robinson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant returned on the warrant.  Entry made without file.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set bail at $1,000.00 CASH.  Parties request a preliminary hearing date.  Court ordered case continued before Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Victor G Robinson not in court, defendant in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel not in the office on today's date and contacted the court to reschedule this case.  File retained in court.  Return on warrant scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on  6/03/15.  Bench Warrant filed.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 20.  Notification made to the Public Defender's Office to have counsel appointed.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court.  Brandon Wigley for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-21-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Victor G Robinson
Current: 4616 West Crawford, Milwaukee, WI 53220   (Effective: 05-12-2015)
Prior: 4616 West Crawford, Milwaukee, WI 53220
Oral No Contact Order with 3582 S. 57th Street and Anthony L.

Defendant Victor G Robinson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
